info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 7:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Big Horn and southern Yellowstone Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 717 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lockwood, or 7 miles southeast of Billings, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusting 35 to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Hardin, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Worden, Billings West End, Ballantine, Pryor, Pompeys Pillar, Acton, St. Xavier and Crow Indian Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
